name: Aphids
description: Small, sap-sucking insects that cluster on new growth, causing yellowing leaves and stunted growth. They often secrete a sticky substance called honeydew.
symptoms: Visible clusters of small insects (green, black, yellow, pink)
treatmentMethods: Strong spray of water to dislodge
Neem oil or insecticidal soap sprays

name: Spider Mites
description: Tiny arachnids, difficult to see with the naked eye. They cause stippling on leaves and fine webbing, especially in hot, dry conditions.
symptoms: Yellow or bronze stippling on leaves
Fine webbing on undersides of leaves and between stems
Leaves may dry up and drop prematurely
treatmentMethods: Wipe leaves with a damp cloth

name: Fungus Gnats
description: Small, dark, mosquito-like insects that thrive in moist potting soil. Adults are mostly a nuisance, but larvae can damage roots, especially in seedlings.
symptoms: Visible small black flies around plants or soil
Seedlings or young plants may wilt or show poor growth
Larvae (tiny, worm-like) may be visible in topsoil if disturbed
treatmentMethods: Allow soil to dry out between waterings
Use yellow sticky traps for adults
Apply beneficial nematodes to the soil for larvae
Top dress soil with sand or diatomaceous earth
